summary: This is a brief email forwarding two memos from the SDNY Public Corruption Unit to the Deputy Attorney General. It indicates ongoing communication between the SDNY and DOJ leadership regarding unspecified cases, likely related to the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: To:
persons.context: The recipient of the email and the attached memos, addressed generically in the email header.

persons.name: Co-Chief, Public Corruption Unit
persons.context: The sender of the email, identified by their title as the Co-Chief of the Public Corruption Unit at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: The Co-Chief is sending case-related memos to the recipient, indicating a reporting or advisory relationship within the Department of Justice.

events.title: Submission of SDNY Memo to DAG
events.description: A memo from the SDNY was sent to the Deputy Attorney General, as indicated by the attachment filename 'SDNY_Memo_to_DAGn 7.9.19.pdf'.

events.title: Submission of SDNY Memo on GSB cases
events.description: A finalized memo concerning 'GSB cases' was sent to the Deputy Attorney General, as indicated by the attachment filename 'SDNY_Memo_to_DAG.GSB.cases.5.23.19.final.pdf'.

events.title: Email forwarding memos
events.description: An email was sent forwarding two previously submitted memos to the Deputy Attorney General, confirming their transmission.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The SDNY Public Corruption Unit was actively communicating with the Deputy Attorney General's office in 2019.
Two specific memos, dated July 9, 2019 and May 23, 2019, were referenced as being sent to the DAG.
One memo filename references 'GSB cases', which may be an abbreviation or acronym for a subject of investigation.
The document shows a chain of reporting or consultation within the DOJ regarding ongoing cases handled by the SDNY Public Corruption Unit.
The correspondence is dated September 20, 2019, after Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019, indicating continued investigative activity.
